current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To authorize the Administrator of General
		  Services to convey a parcel of real property in Albuquerque, New Mexico, to the
		  Amy Biehl High School Foundation.

committee-name.#text:
Committee on Environment and Public
			 Works

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced
			 the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Albuquerque, New Mexico, Federal Land
			 Conveyance Act of 2013
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Albuquerque, New Mexico, Federal Land Conveyance Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

quote.#tail:
means the real property
			 located in Albuquerque, New Mexico, that, as determined by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
,
			 subject to survey, generally consists of lots 12 through 19, and for the
			 westerly boundary, the portion of either lot 19 or 20 which is the outside
			 west
			 wall of the basement level of the Old Post Office building, and which has
			 a
			 municipal address of 123 Fourth Street, SW, in Block 18, New Mexico Town
			 Company’s Original Townsite, Albuquerque, New Mexico.

quote.#tail:
means the Amy Biehl High School
			 Foundation.

header.#text:
Conveyance of real

			 Foundation

			 quitclaim deed, all right, title, and interest of the United States in and
			 to
			 the Federal land.

The
			 conveyance of the Federal land under this Act shall occur not later than 3
			 years after the date of enactment of this Act.
